newsitem.title: TAJIKISTAN: FORECAST - Tajik budget 1997 deficit seen at 6 pct.
newsitem.headline: FORECAST - Tajik budget 1997 deficit seen at 6 pct.

text.p: War-torn Tajikistan's government aims to keep its 1997 budget deficit at no more than six percent of gross domestic product, a senior finance official said on Monday.
"This was agreed with the international lending institutions," First Deputy Finance Minister Sharif Mulloyev told Reuters.
Tajikistan is targeting a budget deficit of 5.4 percent of GDP this year after 11.2 percent in 1995.

Mulloyev said projected government expenditure for 1997 would total around 88.2 billion Tajik roubles ($295 million) and revenue for the same period would total 71.2 billion Tajik roubles ($239 million).

The remote, mountainous former Soviet republic, which borders Afghanistan, has been wracked by a four-year civil war costing thousands of lives. Production of cotton and aluminium, its main hard currency earners, have dived.
